text:
73 y/o M admitted w/ significant cardiac hx, including CABG, CHF,
   I-CMP, +smoker, to OSH [**12-5**] w/ acute SOB following [**Holiday 2419**]
   dinner. Worsening resp distress despite diuresis requiring Intubation.
   BP dropped s/p intubation requiring pressors. Transferred to [**Hospital1 1**] CCU
   [**12-9**] for further care per family request.  Enzymes sent.
   Heart failure (CHF), Systolic, Acute on Chronic
   Assessment:
   Gd response to lasix gtt at 10mg/hr
uop 100-200cc/hr.
   Action:
   Lasix weaned to 8mg/hr
   Response:
   Uop continues ~100cc/hr
   Plan:
   Continue to wean lasix as tol. Monitor Cr.  TTE today. ? adding ACE-I
   as BP tolerates
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 2**])
   Assessment:
   Overbreathing vent 4-8 breaths. LS intermittently course, clearing w/
   suctioning. AM RSBI 52
   Action:
   Pt suctioned as needed
   Response:
   Continue to have small-mod amts secretions suctioned from ETT
   Plan:
   Wean vent as tol, CPAP today
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Not following commands consistently- opens eyes to voice, eyes w/
   upward gaze- no tracking or eye contact. Appearing
   uncomfortable/restless at times. Denies pain by nodding when asked.
   Action:
   PRN fentanyl and Versed IVP given for comfort
   Response:
   Appearing comfortable
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor MS, Versed/fent PRN for comfort.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   HR 80-90s AFib, w/  occas V-Paced. Freq PVCs/couplets.
   Action:
   Heparin gtt started at 1400units/hr for AF. 40meQ KCL given for K 3.7
   on admission
   Response:
   Less ectopy noted
   Plan:
   AM PTT to be drawn w/ AM labs at 600. Titrate heparin gtt accordingly
   for goal PTT 60-100
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Temp spike 101.3  early AM [**12-9**] at OSH. Low grade Temp here, TMax 99.7
   PO.
   Action:
   1 time dose Zosyn given, Azythromycin IV ordered
   Response:
   Continues w/ low grade temp, stable.
   Plan:
   Monitor for fevers, abx as ordered. (Standing order Zosyn awaiting ID
   approval)
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   R glut w/ ?Deep tissue injury & clear filled blister. Per report from
   OSH, from pressure from laying on thermometer.
   Action:
   Skin closely monitored, pt turned and repositioned Q2-3 as tol
   Response:
   No change
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor skin, T&R freq.
   Anemia, chronic
   Assessment:
   HCT drop from 38.3 to 26 in OSH, 26.5 on admit here.
   Action:
   HCT monitored
   Response:
   Stable
   Plan:
   Monitor for signs bleeding, Guiac stools. Monitor HCTs, ?transfuse
   Knowledge Deficit
   Assessment:
   +smoker per report
   Plan:
   Smoking education/cessation once extubated
